eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons

Class ConnectionDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.ConnectionDescriptor

  • public class ConnectionDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of a connection to network. In essence, it is a client connected into the P2P network through an instance of engine, able to send / receive messages and process the requests that arrive in them. Each object ID connected through this OGWAPI has its own instance of this class, however all share the same AgentConnector instance to connect to local infrastructure.
    Author:
    sulfo

    • Field Detail

      • POLL_INTERRUPT_INTERVAL_MILLIS

        private static final long POLL_INTERRUPT_INTERVAL_MILLIS
        How long is the thread supposed to wait for message arrival before checking whether timeout was reached. After the check, the thread resumes to waiting for message and the cycle repeats until either message arrives or timeout is reached.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • THREAD_SLEEP_MILLIS

        private static final long THREAD_SLEEP_MILLIS
        Worst case scenario is, when there is a single message in the queue that nobody wants and is just waiting for expiration. Until the timeout is reached it would eat all CPU on message queue's polling call. Although unlikely, the remedy would be to sleep a little if there is just one message in the queue before checking again. To sleep this long...
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public ConnectionDescriptor(java.lang.String objectId,
                            java.lang.String password,
                            org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                            java.util.logging.Logger logger)
        Constructor. It is necessary to provide all parameters. If null is provided in place of any of them, the descriptor will not be able to connect (in the best case scenario, the other being a storm of null pointer exceptions).
        Parameters:
        objectId -
        password -
        config -
        logger -

      • updateTaskStatus

        public StatusMessage updateTaskStatus(java.lang.String actionId,
                                      java.lang.String newStatus,
                                      java.lang.String returnValue,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Updates a status and a return value of locally run job of an action. See the Task and Action for more information about valid states.
        Parameters:
        actionId - ID of the action that is being worked on right now (this is NOT a task ID).
        newStatus - New status of the job.
        returnValue - New value to be returned to the object that ordered the job.
        parameters - Parameters that goes with the return value.
        Returns:
        Status message.

      • setLocalEventChannelStatus

        public StatusMessage setLocalEventChannelStatus(java.lang.String eventId,
                                                boolean active,
                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                                java.lang.String body)
        Sets the status of the EventChannel. The status can be either active, or inactive, depending on the 'status' parameter. If no channel with given 'eventId' exists and the 'status' is set to true, it gets created. If the 'status' is false, the channel is not created if it does not exists previously.
        Parameters:
        eventId - Event ID.
        active - If true, the channel will be set to active status.
        Returns:
        If the channel was found and its status set, returns true. It will also return true, if the channel was not found, but was created (this is what happens when the status of the non existing channel is being set to active). If the channel was not found and the status was being set to inactive, returns false. It gets wrapped into Status message.

      • getEventChannelStatus

        public StatusMessage getEventChannelStatus(java.lang.String destinationOid,

                                           java.lang.String body)
        Retrieves the status of local or remote event channel.
        Parameters:

        eventId - ID of the event.
        parameters - Any parameters to be sent (usually none).
        body - Any body to be sent (usually none).
        Returns:
        Status message.

      • processIncommingMessage

        public void processIncommingMessage(java.lang.String sourceOid,
                                    java.lang.String messageString)
        This is a callback method called when a message arrives. There are three main scenarios that need to be handled: a. A NetworkMessageRequest arrives ('unexpected') from another node with request for data or action - this need to be routed to a specific end point on agent side and then the result needs to be sent back to originating node. b. After sending a message with request to another node, the originating node expects an answer, which arrives as a NetworkMessageResponse. This is stored in a queue and is propagated back to originating services, that are expecting the results. c. A NetworkMessageEvent arrives and it is necessary to process it and forward to respective object via an AgentConnector. NOTE: This method is to be called by the engine subclass instance.
        Parameters:
        sourceOid - Object ID of the sender.
        messageString - Received message.

      • performSparqlQuery

        public java.lang.String performSparqlQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Performs a SPARQL search on all objects in the contact list.
        Parameters:
        query - SPARQL query.
        parameters - Any parameters (if needed).
        Returns:
        JSON with results.

      • processMessageRequest

        private void processMessageRequest(NetworkMessage networkMessage)
        Processing method for request type of NetworkMessage.
        Parameters:
        networkMessage - Message parsed from the incoming message.

      • processMessageResponse

        private void processMessageResponse(NetworkMessage networkMessage)
        Processing method for response type of NetworkMessage. It adds it to the message queue where it will wait to be reaped (or expired).
        Parameters:
        networkMessage - Message parsed from the incoming message.

      • processMessageEvent

        private void processMessageEvent(NetworkMessage networkMessage)
        Processing method for event type of NetworkMessage. It forwards it to the respective object via the AgentConnector.
        Parameters:
        networkMessage - Message parsed from the incoming message.

      • searchForSubscription

        private Subscription searchForSubscription(java.lang.String remoteObjectId)

        Parameters:
        remoteObjectId - ID of the object that this object has a Subscription created to.
        Returns:

      • retrieveMessage

        private NetworkMessage retrieveMessage(int requestId)
        Retrieves a NetworkMessage from the queue of incoming messages based on the correlation request ID. It blocks the invoking thread if there is no message in the queue until it arrives or until timeout is reached. The check for timeout is scheduled every POLL_INTERRUPT_INTERVAL_MILLIS.
        Parameters:
        requestId - Correlation request ID.
        Returns:
        NetworkMessage from the queue.

      • sendRequestForRemoteOperation

        private StatusMessage sendRequestForRemoteOperation(byte operationId,
                                                    java.lang.String destinationOid,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attributes,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                                    java.lang.String body)
        This is common method for sending all request messages to remote objects. Respective methods, like getPropertyOfRemoteObject will just fill the appropriate operation ID. The operation ID is chosen from NetworkMessageRequest constants.
        Parameters:
        operationId - The ID of the operation, chosen from constants in {eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessageRequest NetworkMessageRequest}.
        destinationOid - Object ID of the destination.
        attributes - Attributes that are specific to given operation, usually common definition of JSON attribute with appropriate value. E.g. when a request to get a remote property is to be sent, an attribute pair needs to be created, where there will be "pid" as key and property ID as the value. Valid attributes are also to be found among constants in {eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessageRequest NetworkMessageRequest}.
        parameters - Any parameters to be sent with the request.
        body - Any body to be sent with the request.
        Returns:
        Status message.

        private java.lang.String createSimpleJsonString(java.lang.String key,
                                                java.lang.String value)
        Simple method for creating JSON string with one string value.
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the attribute.
        value - String value.
        Returns:
        JSON string.

      • createSimpleJsonString

        private java.lang.String createSimpleJsonString(java.lang.String key,
                                                boolean value)
        Simple method for creating JSON with one boolean value.
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the attribute.
        value - Boolean value.
        Returns:
        JSON String.
